sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Basic Traits/Social Traits/Worldly

sections.body: Race traits are tied to specific races. Your character must be of the specified race to select a race trait. However, the background generator draws from all lists, letting you ignore these restrictions. If using the background generator, you can take any trait you gain access to through it.
sections.name: Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits

sections.body: Only dwarves can select these traits.
sections.name: Dwarf Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Dwarf Race Traits

sections.body: Your family brought the secrets of dwarven brewing to non-dwarven lands. Though this has given you skill in the brewer's craft, it's also earned you distrust among dwarven purists. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Profession (brewer) and Craft (alchemy) checks, but you take a —1 penalty on Diplomacy checks made to change the attitude of dwarves who know that your family has shared brewing secrets with non-dwarves.
sections.name: Brewmaster
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Dwarf Race Traits/Brewmaster

sections.body: Your keen senses lead you to hidden treasures. You gain a +2 trait bonus on Perception checks related to metals, jewels, and gemstones.
sections.name: Goldsniffer
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Dwarf Race Traits/Goldsniffer

sections.body: Caves and tunnels are a second home to you. While underground, you receive a +2 trait bonus on initiative checks and a +1 trait bonus on weapon damage rolls for critical hits (this damage is multiplied on a critical hit).
sections.name: Tunnel Fighter
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Dwarf Race Traits/Tunnel Fighter

sections.body: Only elves can select these traits.
sections.name: Elf Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Elf Race Traits

sections.body: Having lived outside of traditional elf society for much or all of your life, you know the world can be cruel, dangerous, and unforgiving of the weak. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saving throws.
sections.name: Forlorn
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Elf Race Traits/Forlorn

sections.body: As a child, you put in long hours on combat drills, and though time has made this training a dim memory, you still have a knack for quickly responding to trouble. You gain a +2 trait bonus on initiative checks.
sections.name: Warrior of Old
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Elf Race Traits/Warrior of Old

sections.body: Only gnomes can select these traits.
sections.name: Gnome Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Gnome Race Traits

sections.body: You've long been a friend to animals, and feel safer when animals are nearby. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Will saving throws as long as an animal (Tiny or larger, must be at least indifferent toward you) is within 30 feet, and Handle Animal is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Animal Friend
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Gnome Race Traits/Animal Friend

sections.body: You've spent your entire life thumbing your nose at the establishment and take pride in your run-ins with the law. Somehow, despite all your mischievous behavior, you've never been caught. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Escape Artist checks and a +1 trait bonus on initiative checks.
sections.name: Rapscallion
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Gnome Race Traits/Rapscallion

sections.body: Only half-elves can select these traits.
sections.name: Half-Elf Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Elf Race Traits

sections.body: One of your parents was a member of a wild elven tribe, and you've inherited a portion of your elven parent's quick reflexes. You gain a +2 trait bonus on initiative checks.
sections.name: Elven Reflexes
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Elf Race Traits/Elven Reflexes

sections.body: As a child, your parents sent you to a distant wizard's tower as an apprentice so that you could learn the arcane arts. Unfortunately, you had no arcane talent whatsoever, though you did learn a great deal about the workings of spells and how to resist them. You gain a +1 trait bonus on saves against arcane spells.
sections.name: Failed Apprentice
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Elf Race Traits/Failed Apprentice

sections.body: Only halflings can select these traits.
sections.name: Halfling Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Halfling Race Traits

sections.body: Your parents allowed escaping slaves to hide in your home, and the stories you've heard from them instilled into you a deep loathing of slavery. You gain a +1 trait bonus on any skill check or attack roll made during the process of escaping capture or in helping a slave escape bondage, and Escape Artist is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Freedom Fighter
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Halfling Race Traits/Freedom Fighter

sections.body: You make it a point to know everyone and to be connected to everything around you. You frequent the best taverns, attend all of the right events, and graciously help anyone who needs it. Because of this, you gain a +1 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks to gather information and Knowledge (local) checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Well-Informed
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Halfling Race Traits/Well-Informed

sections.body: Only half-orcs can select these traits.
sections.name: Half-Orc Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Orc Race Traits

sections.body: You have enough human features that it's easy for you to pass for a pureblooded human. You gain a +4 trait bonus on Disguise checks to pass as human, and Disguise is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Almost Human
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Orc Race Traits/Almost Human

sections.body: You have worked for a crime lord, either as a low-level enforcer or as a guard, and are adept at frightening away people. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Intimidate checks, and Intimidate is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Brute
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Orc Race Traits/Brute

sections.body: Driven from town after town because of your heritage, you have become adept at living apart from others. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Survival skill checks, and Survival is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Outcast
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Orc Race Traits/Outcast

sections.body: A childhood spent scrabbling for every possession and scrap of food has made you fierce and wary. You receive a +1 trait bonus on all Intimidate checks made to demoralize opponents and a +1 trait bonus on all Perception checks to avoid being surprised.
sections.name: Scrapper
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Half-Orc Race Traits/Scrapper

sections.body: Only humans can select these traits.
sections.name: Human Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Human Race Traits

sections.body: From the moment you could walk and talk, the ruins of ancient civilizations have fascinated you. Because of this, you have special insight into geography as well as expertise in exploring lost places. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (geography) and Knowledge (dungeoneering) checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Scholar of Ruins
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Human Race Traits/Scholar of Ruins

sections.body: Your family has taken the love of travel to an extreme, roaming the world extensively. You've seen dozens of cultures and have learned to appreciate the diversity of what the world has to offer. Select one of the following skills: Diplomacy, Knowledge (local), or Sense Motive. You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks with that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: World Traveler
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Human Race Traits/World Traveler

sections.body: Members of any race can select one of these traits, as they represent distant bloodlines intermixed with or corrupting those your race.
sections.name: Bloodline Race Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Bloodline Race Traits

sections.body: Long ago, your ancestors' blood mixed with that of dragons. Choose one of the following: gain a +1 trait bonus on Perception checks, gain low-light vision, or gain a +2 trait bonus on saving throws against effects that cause sleep or paralysis.
sections.name: Blood of Dragons
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Bloodline Race Traits/Blood of Dragons

sections.body: At some point you were tainted with the corruption of the undead, and you have gained some of their defenses. You gain either a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saving throws or a +2 trait bonus on saving throws against mind-affecting effects (your choice).
sections.name: Deathtouched
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Bloodline Race Traits/Deathtouched

sections.body: The blood of fiends taints your line, manifesting physically, though it may be barely noticeable. Choose one of the following skills: Bluff, Intimidate, or Knowledge (planes). You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks with that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Fiend Blood
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Race Traits/Bloodline Race Traits/Fiend Blood

sections.body: Regional traits are tied to particular regions, often specific nations, territories, or cities in a campaign. The following regional traits represent several generic regions that can be use in most campaign settings.
sections.name: Regional Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits

sections.body: You were born and raised in rocky deserts, and are accustomed to high temperatures. You gain a +4 trait bonus on saving throws made to resist the effects of being in hot conditions and a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against fire effects.
sections.name: Desert Child
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Desert Child

sections.body: A hard life on the edge of civilization has made you resourceful but has also given you a streak of self-preservation bordering on paranoia. You receive a +1 trait bonus on Perception checks and a +1 bonus on Survival checks made to get along in the wild.
sections.name: Frontier-Forged
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Frontier-Forged

sections.body: You were born and raised in rugged badlands or hills, and you've become something of an expert at evading the predators, monsters, and worse that haunt the highlands. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Stealth checks, and Stealth is always a class skill for you. This trait bonus increases to +2 in hilly or rocky areas.
sections.name: Highlander
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Highlander

sections.body: The time you spent leaping between slippery logs as they whirled down the river to market taught you how to keep your footing. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Acrobatics checks and a +1 trait bonus to your CMB when attempting to resist trip attacks.
sections.name: Log Roller
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Log Roller

sections.body: Your first job was serving in a civilian militia in your hometown. The skills you learned through daily drilling and protecting your fellow townsfolk gave you special insight into military life. Select one of the following skills: Profession (soldier), Ride, or Survival. You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks with that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Militia Veteran
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Militia Veteran

sections.body: You learned to swim right after you learned to walk. When you were a youth, a gang of river pirates put you to work swimming in nighttime rivers and canals with a dagger between your teeth so you could sever the anchor ropes of merchant vessels. You gain a +1 trait bonus on damage rolls with a dagger and a +1 trait bonus on Swim checks. Swim is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: River Rat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/River Rat

sections.body: You were born and raised on the rolling plains or savannas. You spent much of your youth exploring these vast reaches and know many of the region's secrets. Pick one of the following skills: Handle Animal, Knowledge (nature), or Ride. You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks with that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Savanna Child
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Savanna Child

sections.body: You are at home at sea. You receive a +1 trait bonus on Swim checks, and you can always take 10 while Swimming.
sections.name: Sea-Souled
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Sea-Souled

sections.body: You were born and raised in a subterranean home with little or no bright light. Your miss chance for concealment or total concealment due to either mundane or magical darkness decreases by 10%. You are dazzled for 1 round when you are suddenly exposed to bright light.
sections.name: Surface Stranger
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Surface Stranger

sections.body: You were born and raised in the cold wastes of the far north or far south, and are accustomed to low temperatures. You gain a +4 trait bonus on saving throws made to resist the effects of being in cold conditions and a +1 trait bonus on saving throws against cold effects.
sections.name: Tundra Child
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Tundra Child

sections.body: You grew up among the outcasts and outlaws of your society, learning to forage and survive in an urban environment. Select one of the following skills: Disable Device, Escape Artist, or Sleight of Hand. You gain a +1 trait bonus on checks with that skill, and it is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Vagabond Child
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Regional Traits/Vagabond Child

sections.body: Religion traits are tied to specific deities. The following religion traits reference the deities presented on page 43 of the Core Rulebook.
sections.name: Religion Traits
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits

sections.body: Raised in the church of Asmodeus (whether or not you are currently a follower), you've focused your indoctrinated fervor primarily on the elimination of demons. You gain a +3 trait bonus on Knowledge (planes) checks about demons and a +2 trait bonus on Will saves against mind-affecting spells and effects from demons.
sections.name: Asmodean Demon Hunter
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Asmodean Demon Hunter

sections.body: You worked in one of Calistria's temples as a sacred courtesan, and you know how to flatter, please, and (most of all) listen. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Sense Motive checks and Diplomacy checks to gather information, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Calistrian Courtesan
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Calistrian Courtesan

sections.body: You have been blessed by Gozreh to be as comfortable in the wilderness as you are at home. You gain a +2 trait bonus on Survival checks to find food and water, and a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (nature) checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Child of Nature
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Child of Nature

sections.body: Your faith encourages you to indulge a variety of perverse hungers, leading you to shrug at even some of the darkest taboos. You gain a +2 trait bonus on Fortitude saves against diseases and can gain sustenance from rotting flesh with no negative side effects.
sections.name: Corpse Cannibal
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Corpse Cannibal

sections.body: From an early age, you were trained by a militaristic order of clerics. You are devoted to the teachings of Iomedae and to spreading those teachings by force. Whenever you cast a divine spell that affects any melee weapons, choose one of those weapons; it gains a +1 trait bonus on damage rolls for the duration of the spell.
sections.name: Divine Warrior
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Divine Warrior

sections.body: You spent countless hours of your youth in one of Shelyn's temples, listening to wonderful musicians and singers. You gain a +1 trait bonus on one category of Perform checks and a +2 trait bonus on Knowledge (local) checks that deal with the local art or music scene.
sections.name: Ear for Music
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Ear for Music

sections.body: Your religious training involved serving in the city watch of a large city, the primary duty of which was standing sentinel on a city wall. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Perception checks, and Perception is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Eyes and Ears of the City
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Eyes and Ears of the City

sections.body: You have been raised to view yourself as a blade in Sarenrae's service, or you have taken on that duty for yourself. Whenever you score a critical hit with a scimitar, you deal 2 additional points of fire damage to your target.
sections.name: Flame of the Dawnflower
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Flame of the Dawnflower

sections.body: Cayden Cailean's holy brews invigorate your mind, making you less susceptible to mental attacks. Whenever you imbibe any alcoholic beverage, you gain a +2 trait bonus on saves against mind-affecting effects for 1 hour.
sections.name: Fortified Drinker
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Fortified Drinker

sections.body: Torag's sacred duties are to protect the faithful, take lessons from the great craftsmen and strategists of the past, and prepare against dark times. You receive a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (engineering) and Knowledge (history) checks. One of these skills (your choice) is a class skill for you.
sections.name: Guardian of the Forge
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Guardian of the Forge

sections.body: Your faith in magic allows you to reflexively use the energy of any spell effect currently on you to save you from death. As long as you are under the effects of a spell, you gain a +2 trait bonus on saving throws against death effects. If you are reduced to negative hit points while you are under the effects of any spell, you automatically confirm stabilization checks to stop bleeding.
sections.name: Magic Is Life
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Magic Is Life

sections.body: You have discovered a hint of the dark truths that lay hidden within blood and flesh. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude and Will saves whenever you have fewer than half your maximum number of hit points.
sections.name: Pain Is Pleasure
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Pain Is Pleasure

sections.body: You know that all things pass in time, and are used to having to repeat arguments multiple times to convince stubborn believers. You gain a +2 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks to influence hostile or unfriendly creatures, and if you fail at such an attempt, you may retry it once.
sections.name: Patient Optimist
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Patient Optimist

sections.body: You have a penchant for just knowing others' secrets. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (local) checks and a +2 trait bonus on Intimidate checks made to demoralize opponents.
sections.name: Shadow Whispers
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Shadow Whispers

sections.body: Desna sensed your love of travel and promised you would always be able to find your way home. You can automatically determine where true north is. You gain a +4 trait bonus on Survival checks to avoid becoming lost.
sections.name: Starchild
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Starchild

sections.body: Instructed at a young age in the tenets of the faith of Pharasma, you view the undead as abominations that must be destroyed so their souls can journey beyond to be judged. You gain a +1 trait bonus on weapon damage rolls against undead.
sections.name: Undead Slayer
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Undead Slayer

sections.body: You have fought in several battles, and each time felt the presence of Gorum guiding your sword-arm, making you ready to act at a moment's notice. You gain a +1 trait bonus on initiative checks, and if you are able to act during a surprise round, you may draw a weapon (but not a potion or magic item) as a free action during that round.
sections.name: Veteran of Battle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Veteran of Battle

sections.body: Your faith leads you to see the power and wonder in even the most horrible abominations. Once per day, you can cast speak with animals. When you cast this spell, it can affect animals (as normal) as well as aberrations and magical beasts with an Intelligence of 2 or lower.
sections.name: Voice of Monsters
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Voice of Monsters

sections.body: Your hours of meditation on inner perfection and the nature of strength and speed allow you to focus your thoughts to achieve things your body might not normally be able to do on its own. Select any Strength-, Constitution-, or Dexterity-based skill. You may make checks with that skill using your Wisdom modifier instead of the skill's normal ability score. That skill is always a class skill for you.
sections.name: Wisdom in the Flesh
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Wisdom in the Flesh

sections.body: (Rovagug)Your ferocity is devastating, sometimes even to your own weapons. Once per day, after successful hitting a foe with a melee weapon, you can add your Strength modifier to the damage roll a second time (your Strength Modifier is not doubled if you are using a two-handed weapon). Doing so has a 25% chance of giving your weapon the broken condition.
sections.name: Wrecking Wrath
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Religion Traits/Wrecking Wrath

sections.body: Drawbacks are traits in reverse. Instead of granting you a boon, they grant you a negative effect, typically in particular circumstances. If you choose to take a drawback, you can take a third trait that you have access to. You don't have to take a drawback.
sections.name: Drawbacks
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks

sections.body: You have a strong emotional attachment to a person or object that you're terrified of losing. The GM chooses the object of your attachment. Whenever the object of your attachment is either threatened, in danger, or in someone else's possession, you take a —1 penalty on Will saves and a —2 penalty on saves against fear effects. If the person or object to which you're attached is ever lost, killed, or destroyed, exchange this drawback for the Doubt drawback.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Attached
sections.name: Attached

sections.body: Deep, compulsive greed gnaws at you. Whenever monetary treasure is divided, you must end up with a greater share of that treasure than your companions or you're wracked with feelings of jealousy and ill will. When treasure is divided, if you do not end up with at least 10% more treasure than any other individual companion does, you have a hard time being helpful to your allies. You become irritable, and can't take the aid another action for the next week.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Avarice
sections.name: Avarice

sections.body: You are dependent upon the acceptance of others. Whenever you fail a Diplomacy check, you become shaken for 1 hour.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Dependent
sections.name: Dependent

sections.body: You lack confidence in your abilities or confidence in the universe at large. Whenever you fail a skill or ability check, you take a —4 penalty on that type of skill or ability check for the next hour.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Doubt
sections.name: Doubt

sections.body: Your family is extremely important to you, and you feel disheartened when you can't do what they ask. When a family member makes a request of you, you must fulfill that request or take a —2 penalty on all Wisdom- and Charisma-based ability checks and skill checks until you either do what was requested or succeed at a DC 20 Will saving throw, which you can attempt once per day at the start of each day. You can't take this drawback if you have no family. If you ever lose your family or lose contact with your family, exchange this drawback for the Doubt drawback.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Family Ties
sections.name: Family Ties

sections.body: You feel compelled to correct every action and argument that contradicts your worldview. Whenever you witness an action or hear an argument that contradicts your alignment, you must attempt to stop or correct that action or argument. If you either don't try to stop it or fail in your attempt to stop it (as adjudicated by the GM), you are shaken for 1 hour.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Headstrong
sections.name: Headstrong

sections.body: You are a creature of pleasure and comfort. Whenever you spend a day without gaining reward or treasure (at least 10 or more gold pieces) or spending an hour on entertainment or pleasure, attempt a DC 20 Fortitude save at the end of that day. If you fail, you begin the next day fatigued. This fatigue lasts 4 hours, or until you receive a reward or sufficient entertainment or pleasure.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Hedonistic
sections.name: Hedonistic

sections.body: Your love for another occupies your every thought, and you become despondent when you are away from that person. The person is chosen by your GM (with consideration to your roll on Table 1—56: Romantic Relationships if you used the background generator). At the start of each day, if you are away from this person you take a —2 penalty on initiative checks and Perception checks. If you ever lose or fall out of love with this person, exchange this drawback for the Doubt drawback.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Lovesick
sections.name: Lovesick

sections.body: You plan and prepare everything in detail, and aren't good at improvising when things don't go as planned. You take a —2 penalty on skill checks for skills with which you're untrained.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Meticulous
sections.name: Meticulous

sections.body: You believe that someone or something is always out to get you, so you have a hard time truly trusting anyone. Anyone who attempts an aid another action of any type to assist you must succeed at a DC 15 check instead of the normal DC 10 check.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Paranoid
sections.name: Paranoid

sections.body: You're addicted to power. You take a —2 penalty on Will saving throws against charm and compulsion effects if the creature creating the effect promises wealth or power.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Power-Hungry
sections.name: Power-Hungry

sections.body: You can't abide challenges to your dignity, authority, or honor. When someone threatens, accuses, or challenges you, you take a —2 penalty on Diplomacy checks and Sense Motive checks involving that creature until the creature apologizes to you.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Pride
sections.name: Pride

sections.body: You have only one way of looking at things: the right way. You take a —2 penalty on Diplomacy checks and Sense Motive checks made against all creatures whose religion or alignment differs from your own.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Provincial
sections.name: Provincial

sections.body: You are sentimental, and your thoughts often stray to the past at inappropriate times. You take a —2 penalty on Perception checks to avoid being surprised and on Reflex saving throws to avoid traps or hazards.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Sentimental
sections.name: Sentimental

sections.body: You are sensitive about the way others perceive you. Whenever you fail an opposed Charisma-based check, you take a —2 penalty on all Charisma-based checks for the next 24 hours.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Vain
sections.name: Vain

sections.body: You have a hard time understanding and trusting those with unfamiliar ways and appearances. You take a —2 penalty on Diplomacy and Sense Motive checks made against creatures of a different race or from a different culture.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Xenophobic
sections.name: Xenophobic

sections.body: You are fanatical in your beliefs, ruled by emotion over reason. When you attack a creature that you know worships a different religion than you do, you take a —5 penalty on the attack roll and a +2 trait bonus on the damage roll with your first attack.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Traits/Drawbacks/Zealous
sections.name: Zealous
